content:
Hello,
I am finding it difficult to figure out how to set "Intent" for a MedicationRequest resource. If I set the intent to "order" for all my resource instances, I am getting this error in the test tool - "Message:
Cannot find second value for intent to perform a multipleOr search". I am guessing it is because Inferno is looking for records with more than 1 code. This may not be the stream to ask this question, but can you please suggest intent values for patient medication records in an ambulatory environment? In our table, we have meds that are prescribed and not dispensed; meds that are dispensed; meds that have been renewed or refilled and entered-in-error meds. Thank you!

Hi @Lakshmi Bhamidipati -- you are right, in a handful of cases we require seeing at least 2 values for an element, instead of just one, to properly verify the 'multipleOr' search requirement. This is one of those places. If there is a good reason why an ONC certified system would only support one value here, then we can loosen the restrictions on this test. We chose to lean on the strict side with our interpretation to start because in practice once something is optional nobody will support it.

We recently added an intent of "plan" to MedicationRequest (where previously we only included an intent of "order"). At one point the MedicationRequest Tests checked for all four intent codes (which included an intent of "order") but now it is only testing for an intent of "proposal" and "plan." So for us it is skipping USCMR-13 (which causes a failure). We'd prefer not needing to introduce another intent (since we now support two of them). Can all of the possible intent codes (including "order") please be added back to USCMR-01?
I can see that it tests all the intent codes using the Inferno Reference Server, but it isn't against our server. I might need to dig into this more.
This is hit or miss depending on the patient id I test against. For now I'll just mark this one resolved so it can be ignored.
James Dinsmore has marked this topic as resolved.

Hi @James Dinsmore
I need a clarification:

At one point the MedicationRequest Tests checked for all four intent codes (which included an intent of "order") but now it is only testing for an intent of "proposal" and "plan."

There are several USCMR tests use intent search parameter. Which test is this?

From your post, I assume there are two intent values plan and order used in your system. Is that correct?

This is hit or miss depending on the patient id I test against.

Does that mean some patients have 1 intent and some patients have multiple intents?
